SEARCH
Package uk.ac.aber.cs21120.rhymes.interfaces

Interface IPronunciation

All Known Implementing Classes:
Pronunciation
public interface IPronunciation
Represents a pronunciation of a word in the CMU Pronouncing Dictionary. Consists of a list of phonemes, which are themselves consist of Arpabet enum and optional stress values. Initially, the list of phonemes will be empty, and you should add to it with "add". This might seem an odd way to do things - it might appear more natural to pass a list of phonemes to the constructor. However, this would make it easy for a caller to modify the list - or worse, for several pronunciations to share the same list. Also, we would have to specify a constructor outside the interface, which Java doesn't allow (and we've already had to do once!)

  • Method Details

    • add

      void add(IPhoneme phoneme)
      Add a phoneme to the end of the pronunciation.
      Parameters:
      phoneme - the phoneme to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the phoneme is null

    • getPhonemes

      List<IPhoneme> getPhonemes()
      Return a list of phonemes in this pronunciation.
      Returns:
      a list of phonemes

    • findFinalStressedVowelIndex

      int findFinalStressedVowelIndex()
      Return the index of the final stressed vowel in the pronunciation. This will be the vowel in the pronunciation with the highest stress value. If there are multiple vowels with the same highest stress value, the index of the final one should be returned. - If no vowel is found, -1 should be returned. - If no vowel is stressed, the index of the final vowel should be returned.
      Returns:
      the index of the final stressed vowel in the pronunciation or -1

    • rhymesWith

      boolean rhymesWith(IPronunciation other)
      return true if this pronunciation rhymes with the other pronunciation. This will be true if the pronunciations have the same phonemes from the final stressed vowel onwards.
      Parameters:
      other - the other pronunciation to compare with
      Returns:
      true if this pronunciation rhymes with the other pronunciation
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the other pronunciation is null
